summary: A guide to swapping faces in Skyrim. No program, must be done manually. Text file included.
descriptionHtml:
In the old version of this guide, the player had to save their face as a text file via a console command and trial and error was required to some extent. In this version, it\'s done a simpler and more logical way that I\'m surprised I didn\'t think of to begin with.

[b]Step 1)[/b] Launch Skyrim in windowed mode and load up the character that has the face you want.
[b]Step 2)[/b] Type showracemenu into the console and record all of the slider levels into Notepad. Sometimes the race menu will bug out and show the slider in the wrong spot after you move it. Don\'t worry about this, just move it all the way to the left and count the amount of notches you move it, then record the number in Notepad.
[b]Step 3)[/b] Load up the character you want the face on and input all the slider levels from your Notepad file.

[color=red][b]Warning:[/b][/color] showracemenu has some undesired side effects. Namely, it gets rid of some passive buffs even if you don\'t change your race. If you do change your race, it screws with skills a bit. You can combat this by recording all of your skill levels before changing races and setting them back after. For the passive stuff, record the non-racial stuff and add them back using addspell and look up the racial stuff you should have and add that as well.


For those interested in the SavePCFace(spf) command and what the numbers it generates mean, here you go:

Sex:		Sex
Race:		Race
Slider0:	Nose Length
Slider1:	Nose Height
Slider2:	Jaw Height
Slider3:	Jaw Width
Slider4:	Jaw Forward
Slider5:	Cheekbone Height
Slider6:	Cheekbone Width
Slider7:	Eye Height
Slider8:	Eye Width
Slider9:	Brow Height
Slider10:	Brow Width
Slider11:	Brow Forward
Slider12:	Mouth Height
Slider13:	Mouth Forward
Slider14:	Chin Width
Slider15:	Chin Length
Slider16:	Chin Forward
Slider17:	Eye Depth
Slider18:	Unknown, always the same extremely high number
Preset0:	Nose Type
Preset1:	Unknown
Preset2:	Eye Shape
Preset3:	Mouth Shape
HairColor:	Hair Color
Weight:		Weight
Height:		Height
Complexion:	Complexion
HeadPart:	Unknown
HeadPart:	Unknown
HeadPart:	Unknown
HeadPart:	War Paint
HeadPart:	Scars
HeadPart:	Brow Shape
TintMask0:	Unknown
TintMask1:	Eyeshadow
TintMask2:	Eye Tint
TintMask3:	Cheek Color
TintMask4:	Cheek Color Lower
TintMask5:	Laugh Lines
TintMask6:	Lip Color
TintMask7:	Nose Color
TintMask8:	Forehead Color
TintMask9:	Chin Color
TintMask10:	Neck Color
TintMask11:	War Paint Color
TintMask12:	|
TintMask13:	|
TintMask14:	|
TintMask15:	|
TintMask16:	|	Same as 11
TintMask17:	|
TintMask18:	|
TintMask19:	|
TintMask20:	|
TintMask21:	-
TintMask22:	Unknown, possibly something similar to War Paint Color on a different race
TintMask23:	|
TintMask24:	|
TintMask25:	|
TintMask26:	|	Same as 22
TintMask27:	|
TintMask28:	|
TintMask29:	|
TintMask30:	-
TintMask31:	Eyeliner Color
TintMask32:	Dirt Color(sometimes)
TintMask33:	Dirt Color:Dirt
TintMask34:	Eye Color (Possibly, this was very unclear)
author: Bergtau
